events.entities: Bank Data Breach via Third-Party Vendor
events.eventSummary: Two banks have issued urgent data breach alerts to 69,662 customers following a cyberattack on a third-party vendor.
A hacker has claimed a massive data breach affecting 40 million users of Condé Nast and has already leaked 2.3 million records from Wired.com while threatening to release the remaining data.

events.entities: Trust Wallet Chrome Extension Supply Chain Attack
events.eventSummary: The Trust Wallet Chrome extension version 2.68 was compromised in a supply chain attack involving malicious code that exfiltrated seed phrases and drained approximately $7 million from users. Trust Wallet has since launched a compensation process for the victims.

dailyBrief: Today saw a spike in severe cyber incidents across financial, media, and crypto sectors. Major banks issued breach alerts due to a third-party compromise, Condé Nast faced an unprecedented data leak affecting tens of millions, and Trust Wallet's browser extension suffered a damaging supply chain attack resulting in significant financial loss. The trend highlights escalating risks from third-party integrations and supply chain vulnerabilities, with attackers targeting both personal data and financial assets at scale.
